result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**67 days credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $81.12
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered

Conditions:
No contact with J.A.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible alcohol and/or drug testing.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 24, 2024 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 10:46 AM) Defendant Anthony J. Nelson in court. with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1- 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety as Domestic as part of 24 months Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2- Misdemeanor Battery as Domestic and Count 3- Criminal Damage to Property as Domestic.  Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty on Counts 2 and 3- Court withholds finding of guilt on Count 1. Court accepts agreement. 
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing: 10/24/2024 at 9:30 AM. 
Court withholds sentence in Count 2 and 3 and orders 24 months Probation with the following conditions: Restitution in the amount of $81.12 plus 10% surcharge, No contact with J.A. or J.A.'s residence, Not to consume any alcohol, No entry into any bars, liquor stores, taverns or any place whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, AODA and follow through with recommendations, Maintain absolute sobriety, Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, Defendant to testify truthfully if subpoenaed, Court costs. Court orders 67 days credit, if revoked. 
Court orders the $1,000 cash bond is converted to $1,00 signature bond- conditions remain in effect.

Conditions:

Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(11:29 AM case called.) Defendant Anthony J. Nelson in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Anthony J. Nelson. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached.
State notes will need to reschedule as the plea agreement requires cooperation with law enforcement.
State notes was not able to adjourn due to victim notification.
Attorney Hillestad advises there is an agreement for a DAGP but the defendant still needs to meet with Steve Judd.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts, which the Court accepts.
Plea Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am (1/2 hour) in person.
J.A.

9:44 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony J. Nelson in court, in custody with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 3 for scheduling Arraignment.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Roger Hillestad

(Case called at 11:12 am.)  Court Commissioner Wendy Sue Johnson for Branch 4
Defendant appeared in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier by video from Eau Claire Jail.  State by DDA Angela Beranek.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties/waives reading of the complaint.  On extended supervision hold.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Defense objections.  Court Orders $1000 cash bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Pretrial Conference:  07-13-22 at 1:30 pm.  Hearing:  08-04-22 at 9:30 am.
